content: i drew a picture of what i think is a chubby cute alien facehugger then tried to crochet it for a bag charm or keychain brooch magnet - haven t decided yet success this was totally easy i ve written out general instructions so that you can change the size of the facehugger alien facehugger for the body crochet a circle http //crochet about com/library/weekly/aa091104 htm make an air bag by making a crocheted scallop this is how i did it in any stitch single_crochet in the next stitch half_double_crochet 2 double_crochet half_double_crochet in the next stitch single_crochet for the legs slip_stitch to where you want the first leg to be chain 4 turn and slip stich back to the body slip stich to the next stitch and repeat remember to leave a space between legs 4 and 5 make 8 legs total make another air bag make the tail chain 12 turn single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet single_crochet decrease etc until you get back to the body this will make the tail curl fasten_off and weave the yarn tail into the back optional i made another crocheted circle to sew to the underside so that i could add a little scrap-yarn stuffing for a slightly puffy bag charm for this second one i modified the pattern by adding longer legs and a longer tail also there s an extra round for the air bags - it s the same sequence of stitches just piled on top of each other i originally did one round for the airbags but after doing the legs the air bags looked small so i added the second round it was big enough to need more shaping so i added a top piece chain 12 turn in first stitch single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet single_crochet in the top loops only double_crochet to the second last stitch single_crochet 2 half_double_crochet single_crochet in the last stitch do not turn just rotate the piece in the bottom loop only i e the other half of the loop that you haven t crocheted into yet double_crochet to the end and sl-st to join with the first stitch stuff lightly and sew this piece to the top of the facehugger
